org.apache.flink.spargel.java

Class MessagingFunction<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.spargel.java.MessagingFunction<VertexKey,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue>
  • Type Parameters:
    VertexKey - The type of the vertex key (the vertex identifier).
    VertexValue - The type of the vertex value (the state of the vertex).
    Message - The type of the message sent between vertices along the edges.
    EdgeValue - The type of the values that are associated with the edges.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpargelConnectedComponents.CCMessager, SpargelPageRank.RankMessenger, SpargelPageRankCountingVertices.RankMessenger

    public abstract class MessagingFunction<VertexKey extends Comparable<VertexKey>,VertexValue,Message,EdgeValue>
extends Object
implements Serializable
    The base class for functions that produce messages between vertices as a part of a VertexCentricIteration.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessagingFunction

        public MessagingFunction()

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessages

        public abstract void sendMessages(VertexKey vertexKey,
                VertexValue vertexValue)
                           throws Exception
        This method is invoked once per superstep for each vertex that was changed in that superstep. It needs to produce the messages that will be received by vertices in the next superstep.
        Parameters:
        vertexKey - The key of the vertex that was changed.
        vertexValue - The value (state) of the vertex that was changed.
        Throws:
        Exception - The computation may throw exceptions, which causes the superstep to fail.

      • preSuperstep

        public void preSuperstep()
                  throws Exception
        This method is executed one per superstep before the vertex update function is invoked for each vertex.
        Throws:
        Exception - Exceptions in the pre-superstep phase cause the superstep to fail.

      • postSuperstep

        public void postSuperstep()
                   throws Exception
        This method is executed one per superstep after the vertex update function has been invoked for each vertex.
        Throws:
        Exception - Exceptions in the post-superstep phase cause the superstep to fail.

      • getOutgoingEdges

        public Iterable<OutgoingEdge<VertexKey,EdgeValue>> getOutgoingEdges()
        Gets an Iterable with all outgoing edges. This method is mutually exclusive with sendMessageToAllNeighbors(Object) and may be called only once.
        Returns:
        An iterator with all outgoing edges.

      • sendMessageToAllNeighbors

        public void sendMessageToAllNeighbors(Message m)
        Sends the given message to all vertices that are targets of an outgoing edge of the changed vertex. This method is mutually exclusive to the method getOutgoingEdges() and may be called only once.
        Parameters:
        m - The message to send.

      • sendMessageTo

        public void sendMessageTo(VertexKey target,
                 Message m)
        Sends the given message to the vertex identified by the given key. If the target vertex does not exist, the next superstep will cause an exception due to a non-deliverable message.
        Parameters:
        target - The key (id) of the target vertex to message.
        m - The message.

      • getSuperstepNumber

        public int getSuperstepNumber()
        Gets the number of the superstep, starting at 1.
        Returns:
        The number of the current superstep.

      • getIterationAggregator

        public <T extends Aggregator<?>> T getIterationAggregator(String name)
        Gets the iteration aggregator registered under the given name. The iteration aggregator is combines all aggregates globally once per superstep and makes them available in the next superstep.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the aggregator.
        Returns:
        The aggregator registered under this name, or null, if no aggregator was registered.

      • getPreviousIterationAggregate

        public <T extends Value> T getPreviousIterationAggregate(String name)
        Get the aggregated value that an aggregator computed in the previous iteration.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the aggregator.
        Returns:
        The aggregated value of the previous iteration.

      • getBroadcastSet

        public <T> Collection<T> getBroadcastSet(String name)
        Gets the broadcast data set registered under the given name. Broadcast data sets are available on all parallel instances of a function. They can be registered via VertexCentricIteration.addBroadcastSetForMessagingFunction(String, org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet).
        Parameters:
        name - The name under which the broadcast set is registered.
        Returns:
        The broadcast data set.
